q1: How is the monthly payment calculated?
a1: Using the standard amortization formula: M = P[r(1+r)^n]/[(1+r)^n-1], where P is the loan amount, r is the monthly interest rate, and n is the number of payments.
q2: Can I enter the term in years or months?
a2: Yes, you can toggle between months and years for the loan term.
q3: What types of loans can I calculate?
a3: Any fixed-rate loan: car loans, personal loans, student loans, business loans, etc.
a4: No. All calculations happen in your browser. No data is stored or sent to any server.
q5: Does it show total interest paid?
a5: Yes, it shows monthly payment, total principal, total interest, and the total amount you will pay over the life of the loan.
